meanings.definition: To regard or represent as perfect or better than reality.
meanings.sent1: She overidealizes her favorite singer, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: He often overidealizes his vacation destinations, only to be disappointed when he arrives.
meanings.sent3: The movie character overidealizes their abilities, leading to comical mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Her perception of love overidealizes the concept, making it hard for her to find a real connection.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting overidealizes the beauty of the landscape, creating an unrealistic scene.

meanings.definition: To have an excessively high or unrealistic opinion of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The young fan overidealizes the sports star, believing they can never make a mistake.
meanings.sent2: She overidealizes her new job, expecting it to fulfill all her dreams.
meanings.sent3: The child overidealizes their pet goldfish, thinking it can understand their every word.
meanings.sent4: His perception of success overidealizes the idea of fame, ignoring the hard work behind it.
meanings.sent5: The magazine cover overidealizes beauty, setting unrealistic standards for readers.
